entry_title: 4-Star Colorado Commit Laughs at Report of Head Coach Gus Malzahn Resigning From UCF for Florida State OC Role
entry_summary:
How bad does it have to be to call it quits and say, “You know what? I’m going to the other team.” Man, UCF just ain’t having it this year. The Knights end the season with a disappointing 4-8 run, and it’s kind of wild when you think about it because Gus Malzahn probably had […]

The post 4-Star Colorado Commit Laughs at Report of Head Coach Gus Malzahn Resigning From UCF for Florida State OC Role appeared first on EssentiallySports.
entry_content: More Sports ES Fancast Nov 30, 2024 | 5:35 PM EST How bad does it have to be to call it quits and say, “You know what? I’m going to the other team.” Man, UCF just ain’t having it this year. The Knights end the season with a disappointing 4-8 run, and it’s kind of wild when you think about it because Gus Malzahn probably had one of the strongest run games in the country. This entire KJ Jefferson and RJ Harvey pairing is dangerous and can easily bring in points for the Knights. So what even happened? Think about it: it’s not like UCF had a tough schedule, and Gus Malzahn had a lot on his shoulders. You know the worst part about all of this? This entire 4-8 reminds us of another team that was standing on this exact fate last season. Now, it is hilarious that the team we talked about right now, a 4-star commit from there, is now laughing at what Gus Malzahn has decided to do. Buffs commit Christian Hudson took to his Instagram story to share the latest report of Malzahn resigning from UCF with the caption; “Wow”. This entire situation is hilarious. The season affected the HC so badly that he decided to de-rank himself and take the offensive coordinator post at the Seminoles. USA Today via Reuters Dec 2, 2023; Charlotte, NC, USA; Florida State Seminoles head coach Mike Norvell looks on during the fourth quarter against the Louisville Cardinals at Bank of America Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jim Dedmon-USA TODAY Sports You know what’s worse? The fact that the Seminoles have done WORSE than UCF this season. Dude, Mike Norvell and Co. are 2-9 this year. Imagine that. Now will this Malzahn hiring do anything good for Florida State? ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Well, from the play calling and the decision-making we saw him do with the Knights, it doesn’t look like Florida State will gain a lot from this hiring. Malzahn will be taking Norvell’s job of play calling from the 2025 season and we will have to wait and watch how it pans out. Now the question is, why did Malzahn decide to do this? Well, short and simple answer: he was going to be on a hot seat in 2025. It was either “get fired” or “resign,” and he chose the smart way out of this mess. Another thing we would love to point out is that with the season ending, there is a high chance that Norvell could end up losing his job as well. He has done pretty much nothing this season and we might end up seeing a familiar coach at the HC spot on the Seminoles. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Okay, this might sound like some wild fan theory so put on your tin foil hats. Deion Sanders. The Buffs are on a 9-win season and no one out there could’ve thought that this was possible. After the entire 4-8 fiasco last year, people were quick to label Deion Sanders and Co. as a “playing for click” team. Did Gus Malzahn just jump from the frying pan into the fire with Florida State's 2-9 record? Debate Now see, one of the BIGGEST Coach Prime hater, Paul Finebaum, changed his perspective about Deion. Finebaum agreed that he was wrong to call Deion Sanders “Hollywood” but he also suggested another idea. “Deion couldn’t even get a call from Florida State a couple of years ago. But to be fair, what had he done then? Right, he’s now one of the hottest coaches in the country,” Finebaum mentioned back on ESPN. Now is this a good idea? ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Well, if Coach Prime manages to bring in the same magic for the Seminoles then yes it could work but this is just a theory. See, for Deion Sanders to work and show his full potential, you have to hand him over the entire program, and pretty sure Florida State won’t do that. Colorado had faith and that paid off with a $100 million jackpot.  Let the world know your perspective. entry_title: Bashed for Unprofessionalism, Erin Andrews Throws ‘Everyone Under the Bus’ in a Rant After Privacy Breach
entry_summary:
In the unrelenting glare of public scrutiny, even the most innocent moments can spiral into a whirlwind of opinions. Erin Andrews, the renowned sports journalist, recently found herself caught in this web during a seemingly simple phone call while ordering a smoothie. This innocent act drew sharp reactions from social media, leading her to rally […]

The post Bashed for Unprofessionalism, Erin Andrews Throws ‘Everyone Under the Bus’ in a Rant After Privacy Breach appeared first on EssentiallySports.
entry_content: More Sports ES Fancast Nov 30, 2024 | 5:19 PM EST via Imago credit: social media via Imago credit: social media In the unrelenting glare of public scrutiny, even the most innocent moments can spiral into a whirlwind of opinions. Erin Andrews, the renowned sports journalist, recently found herself caught in this web during a seemingly simple phone call while ordering a smoothie. This innocent act drew sharp reactions from social media, leading her to rally back with her signature blend of humor and honesty.  The essence of the drama unraveled during a chat on her podcast, “Calm Down with Erin and Charissa,” where her co-host, Charissa Thompson, playfully called her out. “On the phone with me, while you were ordering a smoothie,” Charissa stated. Andrews, owning up to the moment, replied, “I agree with all of these comments and concerns.” Among the critics, one notable naysayer, @bobthebuilder63, didn’t hold back. He deemed her phone interaction “rude.“ Andrews, not missing a beat, quipped back, “I’m not Yammering. I am speaking quietly, whispering in my hand.” And honestly, who hasn’t been in a similar situation, trying to balance life’s hectic pace with the need to stay connected? With a candid shrug, she confessed, “I feel like I’ve let America down, so I will take responsibility and say I gotta clean up my act.”  ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Erin’s light-hearted approach transformed a minor controversy into a relatable moment, showcasing the tightrope walked by those in the spotlight. No matter how insignificant it may seem, the expectations placed upon public figures can morph any action—like ordering a smoothie—into a public affair.  ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad However, the smoothie saga was just the tip of the iceberg. Erin soon switched gears to tackle the unsettling reality of privacy breaches that often permeate her world. In a revealing segment, she recounted a disappointing exchange with a salesman who crossed several lines. “Hey, I got this and this and this. Let me know if you’re interested,” the salesman texted, seemingly unaware of her busy life. You can almost hear the exasperation in her voice when she said, “First of all, Hi guys, On Sundays…I can’t get back to you.” As the texts piled up, Andrews recounted her breaking point. After his sixth message, she finally replied, “Hey, I’m sorry. I’m working on a game right now. I can’t get back to you.” The audacity continued when the salesman fired back with, “Hey, just out of curiosity, what game are you working on?” That was it for her. Andrews and Charissa shared a frustrated laugh, exclaiming, “No, enough.” This exchange underscores a troubling truth: the line between professionalism and personal boundaries can often blur, leaving individuals feeling vulnerable. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Adding fuel to the fire, Andrews then recounted another eyebrow-raising incident that unfolded during a game broadcast. After acknowledging the heat’s toll on her from long hours on the sidelines, a curious fan postulated about her appearance, saying, “Erin Andrews, you look so great, you have this glow. What’re you using?” Her witty response was cutting: “It’s called sweat…I need a shower.” Just when she thought the conversation would end there, someone chimed in with a cringe-worthy remark, suggesting, “It’s hot flashes.” The irritation was palpable as she snapped back, “Shut the—shut up! It’s outside for five hours, enough!” Do public figures like Erin Andrews deserve more privacy, or is scrutiny part of the job? Debate Throughout these trials, Andrews has turned uncomfortable moments into opportunities for connection. In an age where every action is magnified under the spotlight, her approach—infused with humor and vulnerability—invites us all to reflect on the sometimes challenging dance of public life. Whether discussing smoothies or sweat, Andrews proves that behind the polished exterior is a genuine voice speaking out. Let the world know your perspective. Debate Debate Do public figures like Erin Andrews deserve more privacy, or is scrutiny part of the job? entry_title: Jim Harbaugh’s Son James Takes Aim at OSU Players for Disgraceful Actions in Fiery Michigan Rivalry
entry_summary:
The dream is dead. Leave it alone guys. Ryan Day single-handedly made OSU have one of the best seasons this year but also one of the worst endings of this year. You call this the team that is supposed to win the national championship? Boy, oh boy, is it a bad day to be an […]

The post Jim Harbaugh’s Son James Takes Aim at OSU Players for Disgraceful Actions in Fiery Michigan Rivalry appeared first on EssentiallySports.
entry_content: More Sports ES Fancast Nov 30, 2024 | 5:11 PM EST The dream is dead. Leave it alone guys. Ryan Day single-handedly made OSU have one of the best seasons this year but also one of the worst endings of this year. You call this the team that is supposed to win the national championship? Boy, oh boy, is it a bad day to be an OSU fan. Losing 13-10 to a washed-up Michigan team had to be the worst thing on your resume. With this loss, Ryan Day has managed to secure one thing; The Hoosiers game for the Buckeyes is their national championship game. Whatever comes after that is just a joke. While Jim Harbaugh has left Sherrone Moore to fend for himself, it’s good to see that his children are still here to take Michigan’s side. Back on his Instagram story, James Harbaugh, Jim’s son, took a jab at OSU. James shared a clip with the caption; “Ohio State players fighting after they lose… Where was that during the game?” Well, he ain’t wrong. During the entire showdown, Day’s offense had nothing on the Michigan defensive line. But somehow, they have the energy to brawl. Wild. Keep in mind that going into this rivalry game, Moore was severely handicapped. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Michigan didn’t even have Colston Loveland on the turf because of his injury. This alone makes the entire Michigan run game invalid as Davis Warner has no one to connect with. And yet the Wolverines managed to bring in 172 rushing yards against a team that has been doing quite well on the defense. Even Jim’s daughter had taken to her Instagram story early on to shout out the Wolverines, and it looks like it paid off well. Not only does this loss bring OSU down from their 2nd spot in the CFP, but it also shatters Day’s hope of playing in the Big 10 title game. If Hoosiers or Penn State win their games today, there is no shot OSU is making it. But let’s skip past that and talk about something serious. While whatever James said is all fun and games, this entire fight thing is not a good look for Michigan football. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Did Ryan Day's OSU choke under pressure, or was Michigan just too strong this time? Debate The entire “brawl” broke out in the first place because Derrick Moore from the Wolverines thought it would be an amazing idea to plant the Michigan flag on the OSU field. Yeah, any person with an above-average IQ can guess that this is not a good move. This entire thing caused a massive fight to break out on the gridiron. Kind of reminiscent of the entire fight that happened during the Michigan v Michigan State game. But here is the thing; the outcome will not be good. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad There is a high chance Moore could face a suspension or other players can also face one as well. The police got involved last time. We still gotta wait and see what decision the Big 10 decides to take for this entire debacle.  Let the world know your perspective. Debate Debate Did Ryan Day's OSU choke under pressure, or was Michigan just too strong this time? entry_title: F1 Fans Blasts Sergio Perez for Intentionally Sabotaging Red Bull Racing Before He Departs From the Team
entry_summary:
Is 2024 going to be the last year for Sergio Perez driving for Red Bull Racing in Formula 1? Checo’s struggles throughout the season have been well documented, and by no means he looked like a driver who could support Max Verstappen. Red Bull might have clinched the driver’s championship, but they are not in […]

The post F1 Fans Blasts Sergio Perez for Intentionally Sabotaging Red Bull Racing Before He Departs From the Team appeared first on EssentiallySports.
entry_content:
More Sports ES Fancast Nov 30, 2024 | 5:10 PM EST via Imago F1 Grand Prix Of Canada Sergio Perez of Red Bull Racing during the drivers
parade ahead of the Formula 1 Grand Prix of Canada at Circuit Gilles Villeneuve
in Montreal, Canada on June 18, 2023. Montreal Canada PUBLICATIONxNOTxINxFRA
Copyright: xJakubxPorzyckix originalFilename:porzycki-f1grandp230618_npPEu.jpg via Imago F1 Grand Prix Of Canada Sergio Perez of Red Bull Racing during the drivers
parade ahead of the Formula 1 Grand Prix of Canada at Circuit Gilles Villeneuve
in Montreal, Canada on June 18, 2023. Montreal Canada PUBLICATIONxNOTxINxFRA
Copyright: xJakubxPorzyckix originalFilename:porzycki-f1grandp230618_npPEu.jpg Is 2024 going to be the last year for Sergio Perez driving for Red Bull Racing in Formula 1? Checo’s struggles throughout the season have been well documented, and by no means he looked like a driver who could support Max Verstappen. Red Bull might have clinched the driver’s championship, but they are not in contention when it comes to the Constructor’s title. Star power is certainly good to have, but it amounts to nothing if it can’t function as a unit, and right now Perez does seem to be the odd one out. It has to be noted that Perez signed a two-year contract extension with Red Bull back in June. While there’s an air of uncertainty surrounding Checo’s future with the team, he is optimistic that he will weather this storm. “There’s a reason why we extended my contract during the year, and the team has everything… So we’re working really hard as a team to come through and get back into a much better season than the one that we just had.” He was quoted saying on Formula 1’s official website. Well, optimism alone cannot guarantee a driver his seat at the top level of racing. And going by Sergio Perez’s Sprint performance in Qatar, he certainly is testing the patience of the Red Bull Racing team. After a dull sprint qualifying outing on Friday, Perez had to start the Sprint race from the pit lane. But as the light went green, he wasn’t quick on gas. Rather, his race car groggily made a launch. Franco Calopinto, who was behind Perez, seized the opportunity and made an easy pass starting from the pit lane itself. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad via Imago PEREZ Sergio (mex), Red Bull Racing RB18, portrait VERSTAPPEN Max (ned), Red Bull Racing RB18, portrait HORNER Christian (gbr), Team Principal of Red Bull Racing, portrait during the Formula 1 Grand Prix de Monaco 2022, 7th round of the 2022 FIA Formula One World Championship, WM, Weltmeisterschaft on the Circuit de Monaco, from May 27 to 29, 2022 in Monte-Carlo, Monaco – F1 – MONACO GRAND PRIX 2022 – Race DPPI/Panoramic PUBLICATIONxNOTxINxFRAxITAxBEL 00122019__B3_0343 Needless to say, Perez will need a mighty big improvement in the qualifying and the main event. However, the fans weren’t sold on giving him another chance and highlighted how this was just one of his regular errors that Red Bull would turn a blind eye to after the end of the race weekend. Perez started the 2024 season on a high. With four podium finishes in the first five races, he looked to be the real deal. But as F1 shifted to Europe, his team suddenly started to struggle to find speed. And as the season is slowly edging towards its conclusion, his performances have plummeted. He has scored just three points in the last three Grand Prix, and it’s just hard to imagine that Red Bull is willing to put up with this. Reacting to his blunder in Qatar, a fan replied, “Every week is like a new rock bottom now for him, lol.” ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad “Anything regarding the drivers… We have drivers under contract, and we have drivers with options that remain between the company and the drivers involved.” This was Red Bull team boss Christian Horner’s response to questions about Perez’s future with the team. 252 points is the current difference between Max Verstappen and Sergio Perez, but despite the clear evidence, it seems like Red Bull is willing to give Checo another opportunity. Making a hypothetical claim, this race fan sarcastically wrote, “I’ve seen enough; give Checo another 2-year extension. Red Bull, probably.” Is Sergio Perez's time at Red Bull Racing running out, or can he still turn it around? Debate Interestingly, Perez is among the highest-paid drivers in the F1 paddock. His annual salary is reported to be around $14 million, which excludes bonuses and other variables. But is the cream worth it when his team’s fans are turned up against him? He certainly has become meme material for the rival camps, and they torment him on social media after his mistakes on the track. He certainly has managed to let this trolling and criticism get to his head, but for how long? “If i’m in his shoes, doesn’t matter how much money i’m making i will just retire from F1 after that moment,” a user on Reddit added. Is there a possibility that Sergio Perez is intentionally trying to jeopardize Red Bull racing? It is indeed hard to say for certain. But, going by this fan’s theory, it looks like Checo has accepted his fate, knowing that he is probably going to be out of the seat for 2025. “Either he knows his seat is gone or that he’ll be fired when his contract runs out.” ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad American F1 fans, on the other hand, made the most of this blunder by Checo and pitched a hilarious proposal. RCR’s star driver Kyle Busch has also lost his mojo, and his performances in 2024 were perhaps the worst of his racing career. Like Perez, Rowdy was also rumored to jump ships at the end of 2024. And going by this race fan’s comments, he just might be Red Bull’s next driver. “Rumor has Kyle Busch has been in talks with Red Bull, totally a rumor that i just made up but how awesome would that be.” What are your thoughts on Sergio Perez and his situation at Red Bull? Does he deserve another shot, or does the team need to find his replacement? Let the world know your perspective. entry_title: “How Much Do You Love Chris Jones” – Erin Andrews to Fellow Broadcaster Charissa Thompson After Black Friday Football Game
entry_summary:
What a whirlwind of excitement it was on Black Friday! Especially as the Kansas City Chiefs barely edged out the Las Vegas Raiders in a thrilling 19-17 face-off! But amidst the fierce competition and adrenaline-packed moments? The real talk stemmed not just from the game itself, but from the playful banter and camaraderie among the […]

The post “How Much Do You Love Chris Jones” – Erin Andrews to Fellow Broadcaster Charissa Thompson After Black Friday Football Game appeared first on EssentiallySports.
entry_content: More Sports ES Fancast Nov 30, 2024 | 5:08 PM EST via Imago credit: social media via Imago credit: social media What a whirlwind of excitement it was on Black Friday! Especially as the Kansas City Chiefs barely edged out the Las Vegas Raiders in a thrilling 19-17 face-off! But amidst the fierce competition and adrenaline-packed moments? The real talk stemmed not just from the game itself, but from the playful banter and camaraderie among the top reporting talents. Enter Charissa Thompson, who took to Instagram post-game to celebrate Chiefs’ star Chris Jones with a cheeky shoutout. “Appreciate you #95 Funny Bunny 😂.” The moment captured the essence of postgame joy. A light-hearted expression of admiration for a player who didn’t just show up but truly delivered! From a lively field at Arrowhead Stadium, this interaction reflects the deeper connections that form within the sports world. But the fun didn’t stop there. Erin Andrews, Charissa’s long-time friend, chimed in with a cheeky comment. “How Much Do You Love Chris Jones?” Erin’s playful jab brought a spark of friendly rivalry into the mix. And that highlighted the dynamics of camaraderie and competition that characterize the lives of sports reporters. Now, let’s snap back to the gridiron’s heart and highlight Chris Jones, the man of the hour. His performance against the Raiders was nothing short of spectacular. With three solid tackles, he proved himself a linchpin for the Chiefs’ defense. Speaking to Charissa post-game, Jones mentioned how critical the energy from the crowd was, stating, “The center snapped the ball without the quarterback being ready, and we were able to recover.” This wasn’t merely luck; it showcased the sheer power of team spirit along with the advantage of home-field noise, which riled up the fans into a thunderous backdrop that disrupted the Raiders’ offense. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad What’s fascinating here is the concept termed the “Chris Jones effect.” This notion is a nod to how his leadership influences the game and galvanizes the home crowd into a frenzy that can alter game outcomes. As the festive atmosphere filled Arrowhead, Jones seemed to embody that spirit, surely vindicated by Thompson’s playful shoutout.  ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad But, my friends, if you thought the highlights ended at the game, think again! Just days before, Thompson had seamlessly transitioned from covering a snowy spectacle in Cleveland to the primetime action with the Chiefs. During a cold, exhilarating match between the Browns and Steelers, she and her crew dove joyfully into the winter wonderland, celebrating the electrifying energy of the moment, where they flung snowballs and made snow angels like a bunch of kids in the yard.  Now, here’s where it gets interesting! Andrews found herself secretly wishing for the same opportunity. When the two sat down on their “Calm Down with Erin and Charissa” podcast, Erin opened up about her feelings of jealousy, reminiscing about the fun her friend had in the snow. “I was so jealous that you were working a game like this,” she said. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Thompson’s take? “The snow made everything ten times more fun,” she insisted, her voice laced with delight as they recapped the playful chaos of slippery slides and merry snowball fights. Erin couldn’t help but admire it all, sipping her drink while wishing she’d been right there, shaping memorable moments among the snowflakes too.  Did Chris Jones' performance prove he's the real MVP for the Chiefs this season? Debate As the season rolls on and the playoffs approach, Thompson, Andrews, and Jones remind us that there’s far more to football than just passing yards and touchdowns. With laughter echoing through the stadium and banter spirited away in podcast studios? The NFL is as much about the laughs and heartfelt moments shared among its stars and reporters.  Let the world know your perspective. Debate Debate Did Chris Jones' performance prove he's the real MVP for the Chiefs this season? entry_title: Charles Oliveira Set on Alert as Islam Makhachev’s UFC Nemesis Threatens to ‘Finish’ Former Champ
entry_summary:
Arman Tsarukyan is eagerly waiting in the wings for his shot at the 155lbs title. The Armenian’s previous outing saw him slaying Charles Oliveira at the emphatic UFC 300. Although the UFC has yet to confirm the matchups, Tsarukyan has made his intentions clear for the near future. Recently, the 28-year-old voiced his primary preference […]

The post Charles Oliveira Set on Alert as Islam Makhachev’s UFC Nemesis Threatens to ‘Finish’ Former Champ appeared first on EssentiallySports.
entry_content: More Sports ES Fancast Nov 30, 2024 | 5:07 PM EST via Imago Credits- Imago via Imago Credits- Imago Arman Tsarukyan is eagerly waiting in the wings for his shot at the 155lbs title. The Armenian’s previous outing saw him slaying Charles Oliveira at the emphatic UFC 300. Although the UFC has yet to confirm the matchups, Tsarukyan has made his intentions clear for the near future. Recently, the 28-year-old voiced his primary preference for a title fight, stating that he’s ready to step up and challenge for the belt. Now, the question is whether the promotion and his potential opponents will align with Tsarukyan’s wishes in case he clinches the gold. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad In a recent interview with TNT Sports, Arman Tsarukyan addressed one of the most anticipated questions in the lightweight division: who does he want to fight next, considering if he beats Islam Makhachev for the lightweight title? Tsarukyan, ever confident, said, “Of course, I’m down for everybody. Charles Oliveira is one of the best in our division. I feel like Islam, Oliveira, and me are the top three in the lightweight division right now because Charles has beaten everyone in the top 15.” He went on to praise both Makhachev and Oliveira, adding, “But when I become champion, I’d like to defend my title against Charles because our first fight was pretty close, and a lot of people think it was close. I’d like to finish him this time.”  via Imago Credits: Imago The MMA world is buzzing with anticipation for a fight between the Dagestani and Armenian duo. Their battle promises to be a tactical masterpiece, showcasing elite-level grappling that could deliver fireworks for the fans. While fans eagerly await this much-anticipated showdown, the build-up continues to spark excitement, leaving everyone wondering when the battle will finally take place. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Can Arman Tsarukyan dethrone Islam Makhachev, or is the Dagestani too dominant in the lightweight division? Debate The lightweight division is eagerly awaiting a monumental showdown between Arman Tsarukyan and Islam Makhachev. However, a hand injury for the champion delayed the highly anticipated matchup and pushed it to 2025. With Makhachev now focused on returning to full health, Tsarukyan is waiting for his chance to dethrone the champion. In a recent interview with TNT Sports, Tsarukyan shared an exciting update about his next fight: “My manager said I’m going to fight for the title at the beginning of next year. I’m so excited, and hopefully, after this event, they’re going to announce it officially. They’ve already told me the place and the date, but right now, only we and the UFC staff know. I think within one week, it’s going to be official.” ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Although no official announcement has been made yet, Tsarukyan’s manager, Sayat Abdrakhmanov, believes that the fight is inevitable. He stated that they were just waiting for the official confirmation from the UFC. Given the circumstances, it seems like the fight is on the horizon. Do you think this title clash will happen soon? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below Let the world know your perspective. entry_title: Who’s Bray Hubbard? All You Need to Know About Alabama’s Sophomore DB
entry_summary:
A fired-up Alabama vs. Auburn is on. A bunch of Bama athletes who have been under the heavy watch include Bray Hubbard, a 6-foot-2 sophomore, who has been under the shadow of other frontline defensive backs so far. The game against the Tigers hands him a great chance to show the world what he brings […]

The post Who’s Bray Hubbard? All You Need to Know About Alabama’s Sophomore DB appeared first on EssentiallySports.
entry_content: More Sports ES Fancast Nov 30, 2024 | 6:03 PM AST A fired-up Alabama vs. Auburn is on. A bunch of Bama athletes who have been under the heavy watch include Bray Hubbard, a 6-foot-2 sophomore, who has been under the shadow of other frontline defensive backs so far. The game against the Tigers hands him a great chance to show the world what he brings to the table. The kid has a convincing stat to back up the expectation floating around him. Hubbard amassed a total of 44 tackles, two pass deflections, two interceptions, and one forced fumble so afraid in the season. Before he adds a lot of value to his resume after today’s finish at Bryant-Denny stadium, let’s take you through the brief life map of this Crimson Tide safety. We know how much the fans have been mad at Kalen DeBoer’s Alabama after they blew up their slim playoff hope with an upset loss over Oklahoma Sooners last week. They have literally nothing to lose in this Iron Bowl except Kalen DeBoer’s million-dollar job. But Alabama football is not just about a single season. They will revamp for sure not immediately, but definitely. That’s when, Bray Hubbard, the young adult will be the guy to turn your head to. He’s a player to bet a dime for. Hubbard is living his second season with the Crimson Tide. He’s a former four-star athlete in the 2023 class from Ocean Springs, Mississippi. Within a very short span, he’s already making a name for himself and earning the trust of the veterans, including coach Kalen DeBoer, who picked him up as Keon Sabb’s replacement during the crucial Tennessee game. A few weeks back, he recorded seven tackles and the first-ever interception of his career against the Missouri Tigers, stealing the players of the week tag in late October. He was also rated the highest grade SEC safety from week 9. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad       A post shared by Brayson Hubbard (@bhub___5)  Mr. Mississippi football had an early start to his career at Ocean Springs High School. After spending some productive years under the school banner, the prodigy received a ton of offers from big leagues like Alabama, FAU, Mississippi State, Tulane, and more. The kid has a loving family as his rock solid, the foundation of a top-tier career and a healthy, happy life. Although he lost his mother in his early teens, Hubbard has since been carrying her essence with him. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Can Bray Hubbard be the savior Alabama needs, or is he just another overhyped prospect? Debate Brayson Hubbard made a unique gesture in the memory of his mum. He took special permission from coach Saban to wear a pink headband to games. His mother, Courtney, had died of cancer when the kid was in his seventh grade. The loving lady, a responsible school teacher, and an affectionate mother made a permanent void in his son’s life. ‘‘I want to make her smile every game. I want to make her happy no matter what,’‘ Hubbard said in a local media outlet while discussing his pink band obsession. The athlete said he loves to wear the band, as it was his mum’s favorite. Even before Nick Saban signed the Mississippi native, fans started to visualize the champ taking off his helmet and the band and shaking the opponent’s hand after clinching a gusty win with his mother smiling from above. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad If you, in case wonder about the root of his on-point athletic sense and the impromptu skills, it’s in his blood. Yes, you heard it right. Father Mark Hubbard has served 15 long years as the OSHS Athletics director. He had also a high-yielding tenure as OSHS’s head boys’ basketball coach. He had entirely changed the trajectory of Ocean Springs football, taking it through a slew of improvements. He stepped away from the year in late 2022 with a heart full of cherished memories. Brayson was under his dad’s scrutiny during his high school days. Now he expanded the horizon, he had his legendary father cheering from the gallery or home during any game. The time is almost there. Hubbard is getting out of his Newbee’s cocoon. Soon, you can see him on the top. Roll boy, it’s your time to shine! Let the world know your perspective. Debate Debate Can Bray Hubbard be the savior Alabama needs, or is he just another overhyped prospect? entry_title: Sean McVay Sends Strong Message to Caleb Williams & Bears on New Coach After Matt Eberflus’ Firing
entry_summary:
In a stunning turn of events that sent shockwaves through the NFL community, the Chicago Bears finally did the unthinkable – firing a head coach mid-season. The dismissal of Matt Eberflus marks a significant departure from the franchise’s traditionally conservative approach, signaling perhaps a long-overdue embrace of change. Former Los Angeles coach Sean McVay had […]

The post Sean McVay Sends Strong Message to Caleb Williams & Bears on New Coach After Matt Eberflus’ Firing appeared first on EssentiallySports.
entry_content: More Sports ES Fancast Nov 30, 2024 | 4:03 PM CST In a stunning turn of events that sent shockwaves through the NFL community, the Chicago Bears finally did the unthinkable – firing a head coach mid-season. The dismissal of Matt Eberflus marks a significant departure from the franchise’s traditionally conservative approach, signaling perhaps a long-overdue embrace of change. Former Los Angeles coach Sean McVay had a powerful message for Caleb Williams and the Bears regarding their interim new coach, Thomas Brown. On Saturday, Jourdan Rodrigue posted this on his X account. McVay praised Brown, saying, “He has always been a guy that had incredible command.” He added that Brown “commands respect by the way he handles himself—and he gives it back.” Those are some pretty strong words! It sounds like he’s ready to reciprocate everything that comes his way. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Here is part of Sean McVay’s lengthy comments today on former Rams RBs/TEs and asst. head coach Thomas Brown, who he also played against in high school. Brown became the Bears’ interim HC today: pic.twitter.com/tTvYGscqkU — Jourdan Rodrigue (@JourdanRodrigue) November 29, 2024 Expand Tweet  He also mentioned that Thomas has a lot of respect for Coach Eberflus. He said the guys would follow his lead, which would show in the next game, but what’s the deal with this new coach drama? Matt Eberflus, the Chicago Bears’ head coach for three years, was fired on Friday. The team fired him after they suffered six consecutive losses, three of which were nail-biters. This leaves the Bears with a disappointing 4-8 record for the season. In a statement, Poles mentioned that they informed Matt of their decision to pursue a new leadership direction for the team after discussions with Chairman George McCuskey and President-CEO Kevin Warren. They acknowledged Matt’s dedication and professionalism, wishing him and his family well. Did the Bears make the right call firing Eberflus mid-season, or was it a hasty decision? Debate Eberflus was dismissed shortly after a final press conference where he said, “Everything will go on as normal,” followed by comments about preparing for the upcoming game against the 49ers. However, his position was already shaky. After starting his coaching career with a win against the 49ers, Eberflus’s record has since dropped to 13-32. His firing came after a narrow 23-20 defeat to the Detroit Lions. Thomas Brown, who was the pass game coordinator, will take over as the interim head coach for the team. This could be a great opportunity for him to showcase his skills, as he’s also viewed as a potential coaching candidate for 2025. But hold on! What if Caleb Williams was the ultimate plot twist in Matt Eberflus’s story? The drama is heating up, and you won’t want to miss it! Sean’s strong message to Caleb Williams highlights the frustration Bears fans feel about the communication issues between Williams and coach Eberflus. Williams admitted, “I don’t have a direct line to the coach. When calls come in, it takes time to get aligned.” While he’s trying hard to step up as a leader, his overzealous approach is adding more pressure to a team that’s already struggling. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad Caleb only caught five of fifteen passes for thirty-four yards in a difficult contest against Detroit. His options were severely constrained by the Lions’ tight-man coverage. This game felt like a rerun of his previous struggles with Shane Waldron, following a respectable overtime showing against Minnesota in Week 12. This situation brought to light a coach who put his team’s quarterback in a difficult situation both before and after the game. With the old HC’s exit, Thomas Brown now faces the task of fixing the Bears’ past errors and bringing them back to life.   ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad    Let the world know your perspective. Debate Debate Did the Bears make the right call firing Eberflus mid-season, or was it a hasty decision? entry_title: Jon Gruden Compares College Star To Charles Woodson
entry_summary:
Charles Woodson is one of the select few members to be enshrined in both the Pro Football and College Football Hall of Fame. He is the most recent defensive player to win the Heisman Trophy, having starred for Michigan in 1997. His historic Heisman campaign has been much-discussed recently since the trend of offensive […]

The post Jon Gruden Compares College Star To Charles Woodson appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Justin Hussong
@huss91_




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   Charles Woodson is one of the select few members to be enshrined in both the Pro Football and College Football Hall of Fame. He is the most recent defensive player to win the Heisman Trophy, having starred for Michigan in 1997. His historic Heisman campaign has been much-discussed recently since the trend of offensive players winning the award could be in danger of ending this year, and former NFL head coach Jon Gruden recently compared one player’s stellar start to his career to that of Woodson’s. Gruden had the honor of drafting Woodson out of Michigan with the fourth overall pick when he was the head coach of the Oakland Raiders in 1998. He recently shared on X that “He could do everything on a football field. When I watch Travis Hunter, I see the same kind of clutch game changer.” We drafted Charles Woodson number four overall. He could do everything on a football field. When I watch Travis Hunter, I see the same kind of clutch game changer.pic.twitter.com/H8GCg5MZTj — Jon Gruden (@BarstoolGruden) November 30, 2024  Hunter is making weekly headlines due to being a two-way star like Woodson, but few have ever shined on both sides of the ball like Hunter is for Colorado. Hunter has 92 receptions for 1,152 yards and 14 touchdowns on offense. He has a rushing touchdown, 31 tackles, and four interceptions on defense. Woodson was a star when he stepped into the NFL and made the Pro Bowl in his first four seasons, including winning Defensive Rookie of the Year and making the first-team All-Pro three times. It’s an honor for any player to be compared to a legend like Woodson, and Hunter has the ability to become the transcendent star Woodson was.

entry_title: 2 NFL Teams Have Been Eliminated From Playoff Contention
entry_summary:
We still have plenty of football left in the NFL season. Unfortunately, two teams won’t have much to play for going forward. As reported by FOX Sports: NFL on X, the Las Vegas Raiders and New York Giants have officially become the first two teams eliminated from playoff contention. Both the #Giants and #Raiders […]

The post 2 NFL Teams Have Been Eliminated From Playoff Contention appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Ernesto Cova
@ejcovap




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   We still have plenty of football left in the NFL season. Unfortunately, two teams won’t have much to play for going forward. As reported by FOX Sports: NFL on X, the Las Vegas Raiders and New York Giants have officially become the first two teams eliminated from playoff contention. Both the #Giants and #Raiders have been eliminated from playoff contention pic.twitter.com/4q98htQiEF — FOX Sports: NFL (@NFLonFOX) November 30, 2024  They’re now 2-10 for the season and will battle for the first two picks in the upcoming edition of the NFL Draft. The Giants might have a new General Manager, as some believe Joe Schoen will be let go at the end of the season. Whoever takes over will have an opportunity to hit the reset button, most likely with Colorado star QB Shedeur Sanders at the helm. Brian Daboll will also most likely be let go. The Raiders, on the other hand, will also look to find their new franchise quarterback. If Sanders is gone by the time they’re on the clock, they might pivot to Cam Ward. Whether Antonio Pierce will be there to coach him next season remains to be seen. These two teams entered the season as dark horses to make the playoffs, but that was never the case. They’ve free-fallen over the past two months or so, and judging by the current picture, winning another game this season isn’t in their best interests. This was a tough blow for the fans, but like we’ve seen multiple times, sometimes a team is just one player away from turning the entire franchise around.

entry_title: Antonio Pierce Speaks Out About Friday’s Loss To Chiefs
entry_summary:
The Las Vegas Raiders were the last team to beat the Kansas City Chiefs at home. That happened almost one year ago. Notably, they were pretty close to doing the same thing on Friday night. Then, a botched snap in the game’s final play prevented them from scoring a potential game-winning field goal. It […]

The post Antonio Pierce Speaks Out About Friday’s Loss To Chiefs appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Ernesto Cova
@ejcovap




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   The Las Vegas Raiders were the last team to beat the Kansas City Chiefs at home. That happened almost one year ago. Notably, they were pretty close to doing the same thing on Friday night. Then, a botched snap in the game’s final play prevented them from scoring a potential game-winning field goal. It was hard to explain how the Raiders failed to get a play off, and HC Antonio Pierce believes there was more to it. When asked about the loss, the Raiders coach claimed that the miscommunication came because the players heard a whistle on the sidelines (via Vic Tafur). Antonio Pierce said "we heard a whistle on our sideline" on the last play of the game. Team will send a video to the league for review. — Vic Tafur (@VicTafur) November 30, 2024  He added that the team would evaluate the situation and send a video to the league. The fans have argued that the referees have favored the Chiefs for years. Usually, that’s what happens with winning teams; they get most of the 50-50 calls to go their way. Then again, given what Pierce said may have happened, it could be a bit of a stretch. The Chiefs have now won 14 games by one possession, some of which have come down to the wire, catching several lucky breaks. They haven’t looked as sharp this season as they’ve been in the past, and some believe they will finally lose in the playoffs. Nevertheless, people have been saying that about them for two years now, and both previous campaigns ended in the same way: with Patrick Mahomes hoisting the Vince Lombardi trophy.

entry_title: Urban Meyer’s Gift For Charles Woodson Is Going Viral
entry_summary:
Former 3-time National Champion Urban Meyer has favored his new role as a broadcaster for FOX Sports, appearing weekly on their “Big Noon Kickoff” pregame show. Meyer’s character has been questioned plenty of times due to his rocky divorce from the Jacksonville Jaguars and the details that emerged in the fallout, but his new […]

The post Urban Meyer’s Gift For Charles Woodson Is Going Viral appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Justin Hussong
@huss91_




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   Former 3-time National Champion Urban Meyer has favored his new role as a broadcaster for FOX Sports, appearing weekly on their “Big Noon Kickoff” pregame show. Meyer’s character has been questioned plenty of times due to his rocky divorce from the Jacksonville Jaguars and the details that emerged in the fallout, but his new coworkers seem to have taken to him quite well, especially on Saturday morning when he brought NFL Hall of Famer and former Michigan Heisman Trophy winner Charles Woodson a funny gift. A clip from “Big Noon Kickoff” is going viral of Meyer gifting Woodson a beer from the Saucy brand called “Stealing Signs.” Meyer is keeping the Ohio State and Michigan rivalry fresh by giving Woodson a beer. Urban Meyer gives Charles Woodson a Saucy brew works ‘sign stealing’ beer. 🤣🤣🤣 pic.twitter.com/i3xiSUK9rL — FFBuck (@FFbuckCLE) November 30, 2024  The crowd behind them on the Ohio State campus loved it, as Meyer brought the team a national championship and couldn’t let Michigan’s recent sign-stealing scandal go unmentioned. Michigan notably won a title last year under Jim Harbaugh, who was suspended three games for assistant Connor Stalions taping opponents without their knowledge. Michigan has won the last three meetings with Ohio State. Michigan won’t have a chance to repeat as national champions this year, while Ohio State is looking like the potential best team in the country and has a legitimate shot at winning another natty. It’s great to see Meyer having a good time with his fellow hosts. There is no word yet on whether Woodson enjoyed the beer.

entry_title: Carmelo Anthony Reveals If He Would Ever Coach
entry_summary:
Being a great NBA player doesn’t necessarily mean a player would be a great NBA coach. The same goes for the other way around. Some players weren’t meant to coach, and others just don’t want to. At least, not in the pros. Notably, that seems to be the case with Carmelo Anthony. In the […]

The post Carmelo Anthony Reveals If He Would Ever Coach appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Ernesto Cova
@ejcovap




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   Being a great NBA player doesn’t necessarily mean a player would be a great NBA coach. The same goes for the other way around. Some players weren’t meant to coach, and others just don’t want to. At least, not in the pros. Notably, that seems to be the case with Carmelo Anthony. In the latest edition of his “7 PM in Brooklyn” podcast, the legendary forward admitted that he would only like to coach a high school program. The guys see Rondo being an NBA coach someday, but what about themselves? Melo: "I would take over a high school program … I'd rather put my passion into high school." Shump: "I'd wanna take a job in player development." pic.twitter.com/TxjtP06YsN — 7PM in Brooklyn (@7PMinBrooklyn) November 30, 2024  That makes sense for someone like Melo. He had multiple go-to moves, outstanding footwork, and knew all the tricks as a scorer. He’s also passed the torch and his knowledge to his son, Kiyan, so he knows how to reach out to the next generation. Anthony doesn’t get enough credit for his career. People also seem to forget how different he was as a player when he first entered the league. Melo was a high-flying dunker who made the most of his athleticism to get to his spots. Once that quick burst faded away, he evolved into a strong, bully-ball, spot-up shooter. He had an innate gift for scoring but also had to work tirelessly on his craft to develop ways to stay relevant. Hopefully, he’ll have the opportunity to share his knowledge and expertise with the next generation of hoopers.

entry_title: Hornets Announce Details Of LaMelo Ball’s Injury
entry_summary:
It didn’t take long before LaMelo Ball proved to be a unique NBA player. He took the league by storm right out of the gate. His flashy moves and passes and his unconscious shot-making, which some claimed wouldn’t translate to the pros, made him one of the finest entertainers in the game. That was […]

The post Hornets Announce Details Of LaMelo Ball’s Injury appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Ernesto Cova
@ejcovap




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   It didn’t take long before LaMelo Ball proved to be a unique NBA player. He took the league by storm right out of the gate. His flashy moves and passes and his unconscious shot-making, which some claimed wouldn’t translate to the pros, made him one of the finest entertainers in the game. That was at an all-time high this season. Unfortunately, once again, injuries may have gotten the best of him. According to a report by Marc J. Spears, the Charlotte Hornets announced that Ball would be re-evaluated in two weeks after being diagnosed with a left calf strain. Hornets say LaMelo Ball has been diagnosed with a left calf strain. He will be reevaluated two weeks from the date the injury occurred on 11/27. Additionally, further evaluation of Tre Mann’s low back soreness has been diagnosed as disc irritation. — Marc J. Spears (@MarcJSpears) November 30, 2024  Calf injuries are tricky; some might lead to more serious ailments. Given the Hornets’ subpar record and Ball’s history of injuries, they would be wise to err on the side of caution here. Ball has missed plenty of time during his young career. Just like his older brother, Lonzo, he can’t seem to stay healthy. Some believe that has a lot to do with the reportedly faulty BBB shoes his father, LaVar, had them wearing earlier in their careers. Ball dropped the then-defunct brand to sign with Puma but struggled to shake off those woes. Despite his team’s disappointing record, Ball played like an All-Star starter this season, averaging 31.1 points, 5.4 rebounds, 6.9 assists, 1.1 steals, and 4.7 three-pointers per game. Hopefully, this won’t be a long-term issue or lead to more injuries, as the game is always better when he is on the court.

entry_title: Stat Shows Why Baker Mayfield Could Have A Big Game On Sunday
entry_summary:
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers mercifully ended a four-game losing streak last week by taking down the New York Giants. They will look to keep things rolling when they face the Carolina Panthers on Sunday. Tampa is fighting for its playoff lives at 5-6, and even though Carolina has been playing better recently, one recent […]

The post Stat Shows Why Baker Mayfield Could Have A Big Game On Sunday appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Justin Hussong
@huss91_




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   The Tampa Bay Buccaneers mercifully ended a four-game losing streak last week by taking down the New York Giants. They will look to keep things rolling when they face the Carolina Panthers on Sunday. Tampa is fighting for its playoff lives at 5-6, and even though Carolina has been playing better recently, one recent stat shows why Baker could have a big game on Sunday. ProFootballFocus shared on X that Mayfield ranks second in the NFL with 2,424 passing yards from a clean pocket. He’ll be facing a Panthers defense that applies pressure at the lowest rate in the league. Baker Mayfield is primed for a big game against Carolina's pass rush Mayfield ranks 2nd in the NFL with 2,424 passing yards from a clean pocket. He'll be facing a Panthers defense that applies pressure at the lowest rate in the league, giving Mayfield ample time to pick apart pic.twitter.com/d7nYITAB0X — PFF TB Buccaneers (@PFF_Buccaneers) November 29, 2024  The Giants game was Baker’s first of the year without a touchdown pass, and last season, Baker threw just one touchdown in two games against the Panthers. Tampa only scored 30 points in the two wins over Carolina last year, so Baker could be due for a big performance against his former team. The Bucs are only one game back in the NFC South behind the Atlanta Falcons and two behind the Washington Commanders in the Wild Card race. The Bucs’ remaining schedule is highly favorable. They have two games against the Panthers and matchups with the Dallas Cowboys, New Orleans Saints, Las Vegas Raiders, and Los Angeles Chargers. Even though Carolina struggles to rush the passer, the Bucs can’t take this game lightly. The Panthers just narrowly missed extending their win streak to three games last week against the Kansas City Chiefs before losing on a last-second field goal. Getting back to .500 is the Bucs’ first step in firmly reclaiming the NFC South title.

entry_title: Kendrick Perkins Makes A Prediction About When LeBron James Will Retire
entry_summary:
The Los Angeles Lakers have gone up and down this season. They’re currently 11-8 and in the sixth spot in the Western Conference. Unfortunately, most of those wins have come against not-so-great teams. They have left some serious doubt when they’ve gone against winning teams, and they don’t seem to be a championship-caliber team […]

The post Kendrick Perkins Makes A Prediction About When LeBron James Will Retire appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Ernesto Cova
@ejcovap




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   The Los Angeles Lakers have gone up and down this season. They’re currently 11-8 and in the sixth spot in the Western Conference. Unfortunately, most of those wins have come against not-so-great teams. They have left some serious doubt when they’ve gone against winning teams, and they don’t seem to be a championship-caliber team right now. With that in mind, former NBA champion Kendrick Perkins argued that this might be LeBron James’ final season in the NBA (via Legion Hoops). “It’s looking like this just might be Bron’s last season.” — @KendrickPerkins pic.twitter.com/EAoQM94eaE — Legion Hoops (@LegionHoops) November 30, 2024  Perkins played with LeBron, so perhaps he knows something the rest of us don’t. James has been as good as always this season, averaging 22.3 points, 8.2 rebounds, and 9.1 assists per game on 49% from the floor. Then again, his recent hiatus from social media made it seem that he’s not enjoying this time as much as he used to. Even so, it’s not like he has anything left to prove. He keeps breaking records almost nightly, and if someone still doesn’t think he’s the GOAT, that’s not likely to change any time soon. James fan or not, everybody has to admit that what he’s doing at this age is remarkable. And if he decides to ride into the sunset while still playing at a high level, so be it; he’s earned the right to choose how he goes.

That’s why the Pelicans might be aggressive sellers at the trade deadline. With that in mind, Evan Sidery of Forbes Sports reports that C.J. McCollum has […]

The post Insider Names 1 Pelicans Player That Could Soon Be Traded appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Ernesto Cova
@ejcovap




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   The New Orleans Pelicans continue to struggle. Injuries have hit them hard, and with the Western Conference so stacked, they might not be able to recover from this. That’s why the Pelicans might be aggressive sellers at the trade deadline. With that in mind, Evan Sidery of Forbes Sports reports that C.J. McCollum has emerged as a likely trade candidate. He’s currently making $33.3 million this season and about to make $30.7 million in the final year of his deal next season. Sidery adds that the market for Brandon Ingram remains “non-existent.” CJ McCollum is a trade candidate to monitor for teams as Brandon Ingram’s market remains nonexistent. McCollum makes $33.3 million before becoming a $30.7 million expiring contract in 2025-26. The Pelicans are likely to pivot towards a reset year amidst their awful 4-16 start. pic.twitter.com/ycB0VxC5Yt — Evan Sidery (@esidery) November 30, 2024  He also reports that the Pelicans will likely pivot towards a rebuild after starting the season with four wins in 20 games. McCollum is a proven veteran. He can play on and off the ball, and while he’s not a traditional playmaker, he can handle point guard duties during stretches. He can also score from all three levels, giving any contending team a big boost. Finding someone who can fit his steep salary on their books will be easier said than done. Ingram is reportedly looking to get a max contract extension, and the market seems to be drying out for him. He’s struggled with injuries, and he’s also left plenty to be desired in crucial moments. The Pelicans have a lot of talent, but it doesn’t mean much when they can’t seem to stay healthy at the same time.

entry_title: Colts Made 4 Roster Moves On Saturday
entry_summary:
The Indianapolis Colts still hope to make the playoffs, but they know they must be almost flawless the rest of the way. With that in mind, Shane Steichen’s team made four roster moves ahead of Sunday’s clash with the New England Patriots. The team signed G Atonio Mafi to their 53-man roster from the […]

The post Colts Made 4 Roster Moves On Saturday appeared first on The Cold Wire.
entry_content:
November 30, 2024
By Ernesto Cova
@ejcovap




Leave a Comment



                            Follow Us                        



   The Indianapolis Colts still hope to make the playoffs, but they know they must be almost flawless the rest of the way. With that in mind, Shane Steichen’s team made four roster moves ahead of Sunday’s clash with the New England Patriots. The team signed G Atonio Mafi to their 53-man roster from the practice squad, waiving LB Liam Anderson to make room for him. They also elevated WR Laquon Treadwell and G Mark Glowinski to the active roster from the practice squad (via Aaron Wilson) #Colts elevated Mark Glowinski and Laquon Treadwell to active roster, signed Atonio Mafi to active roster, waived Liam Anderson. — Aaron Wilson (@AaronWilson_NFL) November 30, 2024  Anderson had been signed to the 53-man roster two weeks ago. He’s made three appearances this season in his second stint with the organization after playing one game as a rookie in 2023, and he’s a candidate to be back to the practice squad at some point. Mafi, on the other hand, has already played for this team. He was elevated in Weeks 11 and 12 and played both times. He joined the team’s practice squad in August after spending his rookie season with the New England Patriots. A former first-round pick out of UCLA, he made 17 appearances (five starts) last season. Glowinski joined the practice squad less than two weeks ago. He had already played for the team for four years, between 2018 and 2021. So far, he’s made 124 appearances (96 starts), played for the New York Giants and Seattle Seahawks, and started seven playoff games. Last but not least, Treadwell has also played this season, being elevated in Week 10 vs. the Buffalo Bills. He has spent the entire season on the practice squad and made 82 appearances (24 starts) while playing for the Colts, Minnesota Vikings, Atlanta Falcons, Jacksonville Jaguars, Patriots, Arizona Cardinals, Seattle Seahawks, and Baltimore Ravens.

entry_title: How a chance meeting got former Tottenham star Sandro out of retirement to play for seventh-tier Harborough Town in the biggest game in their history
entry_summary: The effervescent manager of Harborough Town is holding court at a press conference when he is interrupted by ‘The Beast’ strolling through the door of the members’ bar, which is serving as a media room. ‘Sorry I’m late,’ says Sandro, the 6ft 2in tall former midfielder for Brazil and Tottenham, where fans gave him his […]
entry_content: Home - Football News - How a chance meeting got former Tottenham star Sandro out of retirement to play for seventh-tier Harborough Town in the biggest game in their history The effervescent manager of Harborough Town is holding court at a press conference when he is interrupted by ‘The Beast’ strolling through the door of the members’ bar, which is serving as a media room. ‘Sorry I’m late,’ says Sandro, the 6ft 2in tall former midfielder for Brazil and Tottenham, where fans gave him his nickname, who had arrived half-an-hour behind schedule after driving from London to Leicestershire. ‘That’s a fine!’ bellows his beaming boss Mitch Austin to much laughter, as his new signing sheepishly blames the traffic before finding a space to stand next to the bricklayer, gas engineer and glazier who he now calls his team-mates.   After observing the rest of Austin’s entertaining pre-match conference, Sandro heads to the dressing room to get ready for his first training session with the Southern League Premier Division Central club — more than two years after he last played competitive football. ‘I think I can do it,’ jokes the 35-year-old as he ambles on to the 4G pitch in near-freezing temperatures, the last player to join the group following a massage and his own interview commitments. ‘He just said to me, “Have you got any gloves?” Austin said as he follows Sandro out of the tunnel. ‘I said, “No, get out there”.’      Former Tottenham and Brazil midfielder Sandro signed for Harborough Town on November 5       Sandro spoke to Mail Sport this week ahead of his first appearance in the FA Cup since 2016      Sandro played in 106 first-team games for Spurs between 2010 and 2014, scoring three goals But if his late arrival, massage and gloves request appear to paint the ex-Premier League star as a prima donna, that could not be further from reality. No, this is a man who has come out of retirement to play for free for the seventh-tier Midlands club in the biggest match in their history — Sunday’s FA Cup second-round tie at Reading. And all as a goodwill gesture following a chance meeting with Tottenham season ticket-holder Austin in a hospitality box earlier this season. ‘It’s a funny story,’ starts Sandro, who later poses for pictures with a replica of the FA Cup, which Austin was given when Harborough — who had never previously gone past the second qualifying round — reached the first-round proper. ‘I work for Tottenham at home games, talking to the fans. Mitch was in the restaurant and was saying, “Sandro, you look good, you should play for my team.” I said, “Yeah, why not, man, let’s go.” It was just like that.’ Sandro looks as trim as ever and signed for the Bees on November 5, but was banned from playing for two matches, having been sent off in his last pro appearance, for Belenenses in Portugal’s top flight in April 2022. He is, though, eligible to make his debut on Sunday for the lowest-ranked club left in the world’s oldest cup competition. ‘I thought I was finished and that I was never going to play again,’ Sandro says. ‘It is so magical for me after two years of just watching football and missing it. ‘Now I have an opportunity to express myself again in one tackle, one header. I used to play against Reading in the Premier League and now I am going to face them in the FA Cup.      His shock move to Harborough came more than 12 months after he had retired from football      Sandro pictured training with his team-mates ahead of Sunday’s FA Cup clash with Reading      As well as winning 17 senior caps for Brazil, Sandro played at the Olympic Games in 2012   ‘To be part of this and to enjoy myself and try to help them, it is just what I want. I know they are living the dream — and I am living the dream as well.’ Sandro’s retirement U-turn is perhaps the most eccentric act yet in a life that has been full of them. Famously, he became hooked on darts after moving to Tottenham for £8million from Internacional in Brazil in 2010, striking up an unlikely friendship with former world finalist Bobby George. When Mail Sport interviewed him at his home in Essex in 2012, he stunned our reporter by singing and strumming his guitar to Coldplay and the Black Eyed Peas. Twelve years on, Sandro breaks into song again when asked what tune he performed in front of Harborough’s players for his initiation. ‘Nossa, nossa, assim voce me mata,’ he sings tunefully in his native tongue. ‘In Brazil, it is a good song,’ Sandro says. If his dressing-room singing helped him integrate into the Harborough squad, so too did his attitude at training on Wednesday night, when he could be heard celebrating every tackle won by a team-mate in the small-sided games. That is not to say, though, that Sandro was not apprehensive about playing again after so long out of the game. ‘When I said yes to playing, I needed to start to run because I was just doing strength work in the gym, not running,’ he admits. ‘My body wasn’t ready to go again after two years. ‘I was back in Brazil last week and I called my friends and said, “You have to help me out here because I have a game coming up.” So we arranged a seven-a-side with friends and it was good.’      Sandro has refused to be paid by Harborough – even rejecting offers to cover his expenses   The next match he plays will be at Reading, where Sandro played for Tottenham in the Premier League in 2012, when he enjoyed a 3-1 win, thanks to two goals from Jermain Defoe and one from Gareth Bale. ‘Gareth, I always said that he was the best player I played with. He could do everything, anything,’ says Sandro, who spends most of his time in Portugal and has completed his UEFA B Licence as he bids to become a manager. Sandro also played alongside Brazilian superstars Ronaldinho, Neymar and Ronaldo, who he calls ‘Phenomenon’, during his 17-cap international career. ‘I enjoyed my time and I want to enjoy it again.’ His enjoyment could only be topped if Harborough — who have won two promotions in three seasons — beat Reading and are drawn away at Spurs in the third round. ‘How amazing that would be,’ he says, with another huge grin. ‘If that happens, count me in.’ Your email address will not be published. entry_title: Levi Colwill insists that he would be 'SCARED' to play Chelsea if he was part of another Premier League roster ahead of their clash with fellow Champions League hopefuls Aston Villa
entry_summary: Levi Colwill says he would be ‘scared’ to play Chelsea if he was a member of an opposing team because of the way they have been ‘battering’ teams with their Premier League performances. Ahead of Sunday’s visit of Aston Villa, Colwill has also credited Enzo Maresca for turning the club into immediate top-four contenders. Having […]
entry_content: Home - Football News - Levi Colwill insists that he would be 'SCARED' to play Chelsea if he was part of another Premier League roster ahead of their clash with fellow Champions League hopefuls Aston Villa Levi Colwill says he would be ‘scared’ to play Chelsea if he was a member of an opposing team because of the way they have been ‘battering’ teams with their Premier League performances. Ahead of Sunday’s visit of Aston Villa, Colwill has also credited Enzo Maresca for turning the club into immediate top-four contenders. Having only lost to Manchester City and Liverpool this term, the Blues centre back went as far as saying Maresca has removed the ‘question mark’ which was previously hanging over Chelsea. Colwill has been ever-present in Chelsea’s defence this campaign and when discussing their attack led by Nicolas Jackson, he said: ‘I would be scared to play against us. The way we break teams down and create so many chances on goal is amazing. It’s no shock.   ‘When you are playing really good football, teams are going to change to try and hurt you. We just have to keep adapting to it, keep playing our football and keep winning games. Villa is the perfect opportunity for us to go out there and put on a show for the fans and win the game. ‘It’s due to the manager. He’s come in and given us that confidence. He’s set us up amazingly. We’re going into games and, it’s fair to say, we’re battering most teams. We’re playing really good football.  People are not looking at us with a question mark anymore. They know we’re going to play good football and try to win games. That is what we have been doing.’      Levi Colwill says he would be ‘scared’ to play Chelsea if he was a member of an opposing team      The Blues climbed up to third in the Premier League after beating Leicester 2-1 at the King Power      Colwill has been ever-present in Enzo Maresca’s A team that has contested matches in the Premier League Colwill was speaking to reporters after Chelsea’s Conference League win in Heidenheim on Thursday. On Maresca giving him the opportunity in central defence in his A team, the 21-year-old Englishman continued: ‘There is nothing more I could ask for. The gaffer has given me that trust, for me to play my best football on the pitch, and I have got no excuses.’ Asked if he is happier at centre back than left back, where he has previously been used, he added: ‘Definitely. I will happily play anywhere for the team, but I like to be put in the position where I can play my football, show my skills and be able to show everyone what I can do.  ‘That is what I have been doing this season because of the manager. I’m hoping it carries on.’ Colwill is currently living at home with his parents – and his XL bully Stormz – as he said: ’It’s worth it. I could not complain one bit about living at home. I get treated like a king by my mum and dad and little brother. It’s the best thing I’ve done.’ Your email address will not be published. entry_title: Jamie Redknapp insists Bukayo Saka's improvements are 'FRIGHTENING' after the Arsenal star moved closer to breaking a Premier League record in the club's 5-2 win over West Ham
entry_summary: Jamie Redknapp heaped praise on Bukayo Saka after the Arsenal forward starred in the club’s thrashing of West Ham on Saturday. Saka was instrumental for the Gunners as they ran riot in the London derby, with his corner finding Gabriel who duly headed home after just ten minutes to put the visitors in front. The […]
entry_content: Home - Football News - Jamie Redknapp insists Bukayo Saka's improvements are 'FRIGHTENING' after the Arsenal star moved closer to breaking a Premier League record in the club's 5-2 win over West Ham Jamie Redknapp heaped praise on Bukayo Saka after the Arsenal forward starred in the club’s thrashing of West Ham on Saturday. Saka was instrumental for the Gunners as they ran riot in the London derby, with his corner finding Gabriel who duly headed home after just ten minutes to put the visitors in front. The England international then set up Leandro Trossard for Arsenal’s second, as the Belgian converted from close range to finish off a well-worked move.   Just minutes later Saka had a golden opportunity to get his name on the scoresheet when the referee pointed to the spot after he was brought down by Lucas Paqueta after again breaking through the Hammers’ defence Though it initially appeared he would step to take the penalty, Saka unselfishly handed the ball to captain Martin Odegaard, who sent Lukasz Fabianski the wrong way to secure his first goal of the season. Kai Havertz made it four shortly after, but West Ham proved they were not prepared to lay down and threatened to mount a comeback with quick-fire goals from Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Emerson Palmieri.      Jamie Redknapp hailed Bukayo Saka’s performance as Arsenal ran riot against West Ham      Saka was instrumental as the Gunners netted five times in the first half at the London Stadium      The 23-year-old netted a penalty on the brink of half-time and contributed a pair of assists Those hopes were quickly dashed however, as the referee again awarded Mikel Arteta’s side a spot-kick on the brink of half-time. This time Saka did step up, and he subsequently continued his exemplary record from 12 yards to make it 5-2 to the Gunners. Arsenal showcased their game management in the second half to maintain the scoreline and move back into second in the Premier League table following a recent dip in form. The man-of-the-match winning performance saw Saka take his tally of assists to ten for the season from just 12 appearances, and Redknapp insisted having a player of his quality would be a ‘dream’ for any team to have at their disposal. ‘He’s an incredible role model,’ Redknapp said on Sky Sports. ‘So intelligent. Eloquent, knows the game inside out. He comes across as a fine young man It must be a dream for any manager.  ‘The job that he’s doing and the improvement he’s making every day is frightening.  ‘He can score goals he can make goals, he’s got great desire, he runs in behind, he’s so difficult to defend against.’      The current record for a single campaign is 20, jointly held by Thierry Henry(pictured) and Kevin De Bruyne      But former Arsenal star Theo Walcott insisted Saka is capable of breaking the record      Since making his league debut in 2019, Saka has recorded 52 assists in 182 appearances for Arsenal   The current record for most assists in a single Premier League campaign is shared by Thierry Henry and Kevin De Bruyne, who both registered 20 in the 2002-03 and 2019-20 seasons respectively. Theo Walcott added that Saka has what it takes to break the record and hailed the 23-year-old’s maturity. ‘He’s on his way with a long part of the season without his partner in crime Odegaard,’ he said.  ‘It’s incredible stats. He’s just playing with confidence. The smile on his face when he speaks about Man united, he’s already speaking about Man United!  ‘He’s always up for the challenge. At such a tender age he’s so experienced. He’s making that position his own.  ‘It’s incredible to be that involved at this stage in the season, to stay consistently fit as well.’ Arsenal play host to United next weekend, with the club still undefeated in all competitions since Erik ten Hag was sacked last month.  Your email address will not be published. entry_title: Dan Campbell left furious in press conference as journalist reveals Lions player leaked plays in social media post
entry_summary: Detroit Lions head coach Dan Campbell cut a frustrated figure after being told by a journalist that one of his players had accidentally leaked an offensive play on social media. Before their 23-20 victory over the Chicago Bears on Thanksgiving, Lions running back Jahmyr Gibbs shared a photo on his Instagram story which showed teammate Jermar […]
entry_content: Home - NFL News - Dan Campbell left furious in press conference as journalist reveals Lions player leaked plays in social media post Detroit Lions head coach Dan Campbell cut a frustrated figure after being told by a journalist that one of his players had accidentally leaked an offensive play on social media. Before their 23-20 victory over the Chicago Bears on Thanksgiving, Lions running back Jahmyr Gibbs shared a photo on his Instagram story which showed teammate Jermar Jefferson stood in front of a whiteboard filled with specific plays. Fans were quick to spot that the whiteboard was filled with specific offensive plays, though it is unclear whether Detroit actually uses any of them in-game or not.   Regardless, Gibbs, 22, risked exposing team secrets by posting the photo on Instagram – and Campbell was unaware of it up until a press conference on Saturday. The Lions coach was told by a reporter in that press conference about his player’s actions, which appeared to leave him both stunned and furious in equal measure. When told about Gibbs’ apparent leak on social media and asked if he needs to remind him to be smart about posting online, Campbell said: ‘Oh, I didn’t know that. I did not know that.           Lions HC Dan Campbell (right) fumed after learning Jahmyr Gibbs (left) leaked an offensive play Jahmyr Gibbs nooooooooooooo pic.twitter.com/80wIBGcyTT — The Coachspeak Index (@CoachspeakIndex) November 30, 2024         Gibbs shared this photo of teammate Jermar Jefferson with team secrets seen in the background ‘Ok, yeah, I need to check on that then. Did not know that.’ Before swiftly leaving the press conference, he added: ‘Yeah, I’d rather our stuff not be out there. Thanks.’ Gibbs is currently in his second season with the Lions after being selected with the 12th overall pick in the 2023 NFL Draft. The former Alabama college star has been a crucial member of Campbell’s offense in 2024, recording a total of 973 rushing yards and 11 total touchdowns so far, both of which rank in the top five in the NFL.  He has helped Detroit flex its muscles as a major Super Bowl contender by winning 11 of their 12 regular-season fixtures, with the only slip-up coming against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Week 2. Next up for the Lions is a huge showdown with the Green Bay Packers at Ford Field next Thursday.  Your email address will not be published.
